name: Towarowa Giełda Energii S.A. / Polish Power Exchange S.A.
goal:
Facts about TGE:
• 16 years onf the market, the only licensed commodity exchange in Poland (licence since 2003)
• Strong and stable shareholder – Warsaw Stock Exchange (since February 2012)
• Member of the European Multi-Regional Coupling (MRC) market and the Price Coupling of Regions (PCR) initiative
• Nominated Electricity Market Operator (NEMO) designated by the President of ERO
• TGE guarantees the reliability and security of trading on all markets it operates:
o Commodities Market – electricity, natural gas, property rights, CO2 emission allowances
o Financial Instruments Market – electricity
o Certificates of Origin Register for electricity generated in renewable energy sources
o Guarantees of Origin Register
• Active member of international organisations:
o EUROPEX - European Association of Energy Exchanges
o APEx - Association of Power Exchanges, the organisation gathering energy exchanges from around the globe
o AFM - Association of Futures Markets
• Featured on the ACER's list of platforms for reporting transaction information according to REMIT requirements
• Relationship with an experienced NASDAQ technology partner – X-stream Trading Technology
interests: Climate Action, Economic and Financial Affairs, Energy, Environment, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
“Towarowa Giełda Energii S.A. carefully follows all European Commission activities and legislative files pertainig to the establishment of Energy Union and Internal Energy Market.
Through membership in industry associations, TGE follows the drafting of various electricity Network Codes and associated Guidelines and the new European Gas Target Model.
Furthermore, TGE is involved in: the implementation of Regulation 1227/2011 (REMIT) (TGE is member to various roundtables organised by Agency for Cooperation of Energy Regulators); the implementation of Directive 2014/65 (MiFID II) and Regulation 600/2014 (MiFIR); the implementation of Directive 2003/6/EC (MAD) and Regulation (EU) No 596/2014 (MAR) and all other consultation papers pertaining to regulation of commodity derivatives and financial instruments.”
